intro: Azalea alba, commonly known as the white azalea, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia, particularly China and Japan. It belongs to the Rhododendron genus and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically 2–6 inches long and are arranged in whorls around the stems. Azalea alba thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its fragrant blooms and ability to form dense, compact growth.
